On Friday, March 11 2011, a 9.0-magnitude earthquake occurred near the east coast of Honshu, Japan. The earthquake generated a massive tsunami that caused widespread destruction across the region.

 We hope the thousands who have lost their lives rest in peace, and hope anyone who are waiting for rescue are saved as many as possible.

 'Aidori' is developed for all the people who have lost their families and homes and we hope the app will be of help as much as possible.

Appcelerator, Inc.
Appcelerator JP
Appcelerator Titans

On 11 March 2011, the Sendal earthquake and tsunami struck the T-hoku region, it was an 8.9-9.0 megathrust earthquake. The estimates of the Sendai earthquake's magnitude made it the most powerful earthquake to hit Japan and one of the five most powerful earthquakes in the world since modern recording time. The earthquake and tsunami impacted at least 20 countries as far away as North and South America. Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan stated In the 65 years after the World War II this is the toughest and most difficult crisis for Japan

Appcelerator is working with the Appcelerator Developer Community and many other volunteers to help with the Japan 2011 earthquake and tsunami disasters. 

We hope that this application can assist the people of Japan as well as raise awareness of the seriousness of the situation.

The following volunteers spent a lot of their personal time either designing, coding or testing Aidori and we'd like to recognize them here.

A massive 8.9/9.0 magnitude earthquake hit the Pacific Ocean nearby Northeastern Japan at around 2:46pm on March 11 (JST) causing damage with blackouts, fire and tsunami. On this page we are providing the information regarding the disaster and damage with realtime updates.\n\nThe large earthquake triggered a tsunami warning for countries all around the Pacific ocean.

The success of iPhone and Android, the emergence of Tablet computing, and the promise of Desktop Linux have created great opportunities for application developers..as well as created a new set of challenges. While the market for applications is larger than ever before, developing and supporting multiple platforms can be complicated and expensive.

A free and open source application development platform, Titanium lets you create native mobile, tablet and desktop application experiences using existing web skills like Javascript, HTML, CSS, Python, Ruby, and PHP.
